body.p: Pyzor is a Python implementation of a spam-blocking networked system that use spam signatures to identify them. Concentrations will be on a clear, language-independent, lightweight specification.
Pyzor will contain both a client and server for the protocol. The protocol will be designed and documented such that it is not tied to the implementation.

Pyzor initially started out to be merely a Python implementation of Razor, but due to the protocol and the fact that Razor's server is not Free Software, I decided to Pyzor should be based upon a new protocol.
As of yet, there has been no release of Pyzor. However, I plan to produce a release by 2002-04-15. You are welcome to join the mailing list.
